title: Liouba Bortniker
summary: Liouba Bortniker (1860 – after 1903) was a mathematician from the Russian Empire who became a naturalized French citizen, was the first woman to earn an agrégation in mathematics, the inaugural winner of the Peccot–Vimont prize of the Collège de France, and the first woman to publish in the Comptes rendus de l'Académie des Sciences.[1] She was known for her work on cyclides.[2]
